definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes

sentences.english: The two sisters share the same likes and dislikes.
sentences.chinese: 这两姐妹有相同的好恶爱憎。
这就是为什么“爱憎交织”如此重要。

sentences.english: I usually will ask your helpful, neither overbearing nor servile, likes and dislikes clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我在平时就要求自己乐于助人，不卑不亢，爱憎分明。

sentences.english: True friendship have in common to hate.
sentences.chinese: 真正的友谊产生于共同的爱憎之中。

definition: to appraise/to pass judgment on/to speak ill of/praise and censure/appraisal
four types of human emotions, namely: happiness 歡喜|欢喜[huan1 xi3], anger 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4], sorrow 悲哀[bei1 ai1] and joy 快樂|快乐[kuai4 le4]
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
human nature/humanity/human/the totality of human attributes
